subject: Load kernel module for MPX-885 card fixing TIVI-2713
commitMessage:
Load kernel module for MPX-885 card fixing TIVI-2713

With no PCI subsystem ID we tell the cx23885 driver
the MPX-885 video caputuring card is used.

Change-Id: I2cf1b81d3085b9da106cce598f854e45e290363d

subject: Disable i8042 autoprobe
commitMessage:
Disable i8042 autoprobe

i8042 serial I/O controller init takes considerably long time
and adds to IVI boot time. Fixes TIVI-2291.

Change-Id: Iabec307287bbdd9f0d73775dba22d472455bb893
Signed-off-by: Mikko Ylinen <mikko.ylinen@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Verified on IVI BB system.

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project devel:ivi: 

 repository     arch           result         

 emulator       i586           succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Mobile: 

 repository     arch           result         

 arm            x86_64         disabled       

 arm            armv7l         succeeded      

 arm            i586           disabled       

 emulator       i586           succeeded      

 atom           i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 emulator       i586           succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:Generic: 

 repository     arch           result         

 x86_64-wayland x86_64         succeeded      

 ia32-wayland   i586           succeeded      

 arm64-wayland  aarch64        broken         

 arm64-x11      aarch64        broken         

 armv7-x11      armv7l         broken         

 cross-accel    aarch64        broken         

 cross-accel    x86_64         broken         

 cross-accel    armv7l         broken         

 cross-accel    i586           broken         

 ia32-x11       i586           succeeded      

 x86_64-x11     x86_64         succeeded      

 armv7-wayland  armv7l         broken

Patch Set 1:

any feedback?

Patch Set 1:

Hi Mikko,

Have you verified if this change still allows us to load the atkbd driver (needed for when running in VMware)? Let me know if not and I'll take a stab at it.

Thanks,
Geoffroy

Patch Set 1:

Geoffroy, I don't have a VMware setup so I'm not able to verify on it.

Patch Set 1:

So is this a temporary work-around or the final fix?

I do not understand this "autoprobe" part. Why would this be autoprobed? Which process/daemon/entity does this?

What about Geoffroy's udev changes? Are they needed? Are they correct? How are they related to your patch?

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Hi Mikko,

I have verified that with this patch, the VMware image still works fine and the atkbd and serio drivers are correctly loaded enabling the mouse/keyboard to work correctly inside the image. The 99-atkbd.rule is still on my system (under /usr/lib/udev/rules.d/).

Thanks,
Geoffroy

Patch Set 1:

Sounds good, thanks Geoffroy. Although I'd be very interested to be a bit educated about the details of how this all works.

Patch Set 1: -Verified -Code-Review

I'll defer to Mikko for this, I'd love to be better educated on this one too!

But at least there does not seem to be any undesirable side-effect that I could see under VMware.

Patch Set 1:

The keyboard controller is probed by the kernel and therefore a modalias file is created.

udev (80-drivers.rules more specifically) loads i8042 based on modalias and modules.alias link.

blacklist can be used to block the loading. It can be discussed whether the change should be in blacklist.conf or in an i8042 specific .conf file.

This works with VMware because 99-atkbd.rules calls modprobe atkbd.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

Any further feedback?

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I do not have feedback, since I did not really understand why this helps, but I did not try hard either :-) But it works, so I do not have objections.

Hmm, actually, +1 means exactly that.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks okay, thanks.
Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased
Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Use $(libdir) instead of $(prefix)/lib in Makefile
commitMessage:
Use $(libdir) instead of $(prefix)/lib in Makefile

This helps maintain consistency between paths used in Makefile and those
provided by the build system used in spec (e.g. %_libdir).

Change-Id: I5c44ad14d127987eb7f0db8b6273eab0ca5922ea
Forwarded: yes
